intro: Hieracium finmarkicum, commonly known as the Finmark hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to northern regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow or orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and arctic environments, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It has a rosette of basal leaves and produces a single flower head at the end of a stem. Hieracium finmarkicum is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand cold climates.
